meanings.definition: Not tranquil or calm; restless or disturbed.
meanings.sent1: The unquiet child could not sit still in class.
meanings.sent2: The unquiet wind rustled the leaves outside.
meanings.sent3: The unquiet puppy kept chasing its tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: Her unquiet mind raced with worries and fears.
meanings.sent5: The unquiet sea roared with crashing waves.

meanings.sent1: The unquiet neighbors played loud music late into the night.
meanings.sent2: The unquiet construction work disrupted the peaceful neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The unquiet alarm clock startled him awake every morning.
meanings.sent4: His unquiet actions led to chaos and confusion.
meanings.sent5: The unquiet protest echoed through the streets, demanding change.

meanings.sent1: The unquiet library was filled with chatter and laughter.
meanings.sent2: The unquiet city never seemed to sleep with its constant noise.
meanings.sent3: The unquiet classroom buzzed with excitement before the test.
meanings.sent4: Her unquiet thoughts kept her awake at night.
meanings.sent5: The unquiet forest was alive with the sounds of animals and insects.
